attributes.action: British Government to ask British Museum to return the Elgin Marbles
attributes.background: Elgin Marbles are part of the surviving sculptures of the Parthenon  in Greece , as well as sculptures from the Propylaea and Erechtheum.The  Marbles were transported by sea to Britain.  Lord Byron described the act of removal as   actions of vandalism or looting.The marbles  should be returned.

rejection.details: The repatriation of an item from the collection of the British Museum is a matter for the Trustees of the British Museum, not the UK Government or Parliament.
